summary: The speaker expresses frustration with the inconvenience of eating, from grocery shopping and cooking to consuming meals. They argue that eating is a hassle and that they would prefer not to eat at all if possible. The speaker mentions having ADHD, which makes feeding themselves even more challenging due to their inability to eat when not in the mood. They criticize the American food system, claiming that most food is unhealthy. The tone is sarcastic and exasperated, with a humorous undertone despite the complaints.
keywords: eating, inconvenient, grocery shopping, cooking, meal prep, ADHD, neurodivergent, food, America, poison, taxes, bills, healthy, nourishment
creator_demographic: Age: Unknown, Gender: Unknown, Geographic Location: Unknown
